External Memory Controller (EMC)
Peripheral Input/Output
Collaboration diagram for External Memory Controller (EMC):

Detailed Description

The EMC API allows configuration of the external memory controller.

The EMC is usually initialized by the OS at startup using the following sample code:

Macros

#define I_EMC_SETATTR
 IOCTL request to set the attributes.
 

Enumerations

enum  emc_mode_t {
  EMC_MODE_BUS8,
  EMC_MODE_BUS16,
  EMC_MODE_BUS32,
  EMC_MODE_STATIC,
  EMC_MODE_DYNAMIC,
  EMC_MODE_PAGEMODE,
  EMC_MODE_CSPOL_HIGH,
  EMC_MODE_CSPOL_LOW,
  EMC_MODE_BYTELANE_HIGH,
  EMC_MODE_BYTELANE_LOW,
  EMC_MODE_EXTWAIT,
  EMC_MODE_BUFFER,
  EMC_MODE_WP,
  EMC_MODE_LITTLE_ENDIAN,
  EMC_MODE_BIT_ENDIAN,
  EMC_MODE_ADDR_MIRROR,
  EMC_MODE_USEBLS
}
 See below for details. More...
 

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum emc_mode_t

These are the flags for mode in emc_attr_t

Enumerator
EMC_MODE_BUS8 

8-bit bus width

EMC_MODE_BUS16 

16-bit bus width

EMC_MODE_BUS32 

32-bit bus width (default)

EMC_MODE_STATIC 

Static memory (default)

EMC_MODE_DYNAMIC 

Dynamic memory

EMC_MODE_PAGEMODE 

Page mode

EMC_MODE_CSPOL_HIGH 

Active high chip select

EMC_MODE_CSPOL_LOW 

Active high chip select (default)

EMC_MODE_BYTELANE_HIGH 

Byte lane bytes are high for reads and low for writes (default)

EMC_MODE_BYTELANE_LOW 

Byte lane bytes are low for reads and writes

EMC_MODE_EXTWAIT 

Enable Extended wait

EMC_MODE_BUFFER 

Enable buffer

EMC_MODE_WP 

Enable write protect

EMC_MODE_LITTLE_ENDIAN 

Little Endian mode (default)

EMC_MODE_BIT_ENDIAN 

Little Endian mode (default)

EMC_MODE_ADDR_MIRROR 

Address mirror

EMC_MODE_USEBLS 

Enable BLS signal
